alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 12:33AM PDT until August 13 at 3:30AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern San Diego County in southwestern California... * Until 330 AM PDT. * At 1233 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the San Diego County deserts. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen to the west of Desert Shores. Thunderstorms with torrential rainfall are moving slowly towards the southwest. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Ocotillo Wells, Hwy S22 Between Borrego Springs And Imperial County Line, Fish Creek Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
